Source code for awt_quant.portfolio.multi_factor_analysis.DataCollector

import yfinance as yf
# import pandas as pd

# temporary datacollector for the construction of hypothetical portfolios 
# each asset is equally weighted in the portfolio; we have n assets, and each contributes 1/n to porftolio's return.



[docs]
class DataCollector:
    def __init__(self, tickers, start_date, end_date):
        self.tickers = tickers
        self.start_date = start_date
        self.end_date = end_date



[docs]
    def fetch_price_data(self):
        data = {}
        for ticker in self.tickers:
            stock_data = yf.download(ticker, start=self.start_date, end=self.end_date)
            data[ticker] = stock_data
        return data





[docs]
    def calculate_historical_returns(self, data):
        returns_data = {}
        for ticker, df in data.items():
            df['Daily_Return'] = df['Adj Close'].pct_change()
            df.dropna(subset=['Daily_Return'], inplace=True)
            returns_data[ticker] = df[['Daily_Return']]  # Keep only 'Daily_Return' column with the same ticker name
        return returns_data





# example usage
if __name__ == "__main__":
    collector = DataCollector(["AAPL", "MSFT"], "2020-01-01", "2021-01-01")
    price_data = collector.fetch_price_data()
    returns_data = collector.calculate_historical_returns(price_data)
    for ticker, df in returns_data.items():
        print(f"Data for {ticker}:")
        print(df.head())
